SEARCH

Class MathVector

java.lang.Object
MathVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<MathVector>
public class MathVector extends Object implements Comparable<MathVector>
A MathVector class that allows basic vector operations for both 2D and 3D vectors.
Author:
franklin

      public MathVector crossProduct3D(MathVector otherVector)
      Computes the cross product of this vector and another 3D vector.

      Returns:
      the resulting vector from the cross product
      Throws:

    • crossProduct2D

      public double crossProduct2D(MathVector otherVector)
      Computes the cross product of this vector and another 2D vector.
      Parameters:
      otherVector - the other 2D vector
      Returns:
      the scalar value resulting from the cross product
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either vector is not 2D

    • scalarTripleProduct

      public double scalarTripleProduct(MathVector a, MathVector b)
      Computes the scalar triple product of this vector with two other vectors. The scalar triple product is calculated as the dot product of this vector and the cross product of vectors a and b.
      Parameters:
      a - the first vector for the cross product.
      b - the second vector for the cross product.
      Returns:
      the scalar triple product.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors are not of the same size.

    • scalarProjectionOf

      public double scalarProjectionOf(MathVector b)
      Computes the scalar projection of vector b onto this vector. The scalar projection is the magnitude of the projection of one vector onto another.
      Parameters:
      b - the vector to project.
      Returns:
      the scalar projection of b onto this vector.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors are not of the same size.

    • vectorProjectionOf

      public MathVector vectorProjectionOf(MathVector b)
      Computes the vector projection of vector b onto this vector. The vector projection is the projection of one vector onto another.
      Parameters:
      b - the vector to project.
      Returns:
      the vector projection of b onto this vector.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors are not of the same size.

    • isParallel

      public boolean isParallel(MathVector otherVector)
      Checks if this vector is parallel to another vector. Two vectors are parallel if their dot product equals the product of their magnitudes.
      Parameters:
      otherVector - the vector to compare against.
      Returns:
      true if the vectors are parallel, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors are not of the same size.

    • isPerpendicular

      public boolean isPerpendicular(MathVector otherVector)
      Checks if this vector is perpendicular to another vector. Two vectors are perpendicular if their dot product is zero.
      Parameters:
      otherVector - the vector to compare against.
      Returns:
      true if the vectors are perpendicular, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors are not of the same size.

    • distance

      public double distance(MathVector otherVector)
      Calculates the Euclidean distance between this vector and another vector.
      Parameters:
      otherVector - the other vector
      Returns:
      the distance between the two vectors
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors are not the same size

      Returns:
      the angle in radians between the two vectors

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the vector.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string in the form "invalid input: '<'x, y, z>" for 3D vectors or "invalid input: '<'x, y>" for 2D vectors

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(MathVector otherVector)
      Compares this vector to another vector first by size (2D vectors before 3D vectors), then by the highest x-value (in descending order).
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<MathVector>
      Parameters:
      otherVector - the other vector to compare with
      Returns:
      a negative integer if this vector comes before the other vector, a positive integer if this vector comes after the other vector, or 0 if they are considered equal.
